Room.Name: Road to Neraka
Room.Description: You are walking along a dusty, well-travelled road heading north and south. The hard-packed soil makes you think about how much traffic this place must be getting, and then you wonder about who is making all this dust and footprints. Ahead, to the south, you see something dark and massive looming on the horizon, and closer to you, there is a guard's tent.

Room.Name: Before a guard's tent
Room.Description: You are walking along a dusty, well-travelled road heading south and west. The hard-packed soil makes you think about how much traffic this place must be getting, and then you wonder about who is making all this dust and footprints. To the east is a guard's tent. You can hear many shouts and cries from the village to the south.

Room.Name: A guard's tent
Room.Description: This is a pretty bland tent ... white canvas, a desk, piles upon piles of paperwork, and a draconian. How exciting ... the exit leads west to the main road. You've got this urge to get out there as soon as you can, so you're not asked (or forced) to help with the papers.

Room.Name: Road to Neraka
Room.Description: This is definitely a village road ... the footprints are everywhere and the path is beaten pretty badly. Patches of green and red blood soak into the dirt, evidence of fights among the draconians and other members of the army. To the north, you can get away from the evil surrounding this place, and to the south, you can see the northern gates.

Room.Name: Northern city gates
Room.Description: So these are the northern city gates of Neraka ... one look at the masonry tells you that they were constructed hastily but with great attention to their strength. A massive blackened metal gate spans the gap between the grey stone walls, but it is swung wide open. To the east and west, you can see guard towers. North will take you back to the dusty trail, and south lies the village itself.

Room.Name: Inside the village of Neraka
Room.Description: Just inside the northern city limits, you can see it all from here: the tent city, the thousands of draconians soldiers, the hundreds of Dragons, and the countless human, goblin, and minotaur mercenaries milling about, waiting for orders from their commanders. And in the center of the village, black and awful, is the Temple of Takhisis. Whenever someone comes to Neraka and they see the Temple, it never leaves their mind.

Room.Name: The village of Neraka
Room.Description: You are in the village of Neraka. Although you're not quite inside the village yet, you can still see thousands of soldiers wandering about, some training, some lounging lazily. Very few citizens of Neraka can be seen throughout the crowd. You also sense a great presence in the place, one that you can not be sure of what it is but one that you're sure that you know ...

Room.Name: A small trash dump
Room.Description: Hrmmm ... a trash dump here? That's odd ... these aren't usually located so close to a village, let alone the entrance to a village. But looking south, this doesn't look like much of a village anymore ... more like an army camp. The stench is unbearable ... like rotting flesh. Maybe you'd better leave ...

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back east.

Room.Name: The village of Neraka
Room.Description: You are in the village of Neraka. Although you're not quite inside the village yet, you can still see thousands of soldiers wandering about, some training, some lounging lazily. Civilians and citizens of Neraka are also lightly peppered throughout the crowd. You also sense a great presence in the place, one that you can not be sure of what it is but one that you're sure that you know ...

Room.Name: Before the Temple
Room.Description: You stand before the Temple and now you know what it is that you felt upon entering Neraka. It is the presence of an almighty evil, one that will stop at nothing to stop everything. You can see the Temple clearly from here, and you recognize with awe what it is that you see above the doorway.

ExtraDescription.Description: Even from here, you can tell what it is that you see above the doorway of the Temple ... It is a relief of a Five-Headed Dragon.

Room.Name: Northern entrance to the Temple
Room.Description: You stand before the Northern Entrance to the Temple of Takhisis ... THE Temple of Takhisis. It is here that Takhisis is rumored to make her earthly home, and it is here where the link to her earthly power resides. Two enormous black pillars stand on either side of the gaping black doorway. They are inscribed with hundreds of evil and chaotic runes and images of the evil gods. A gigantic relief of The Five-Headed Dragon stands above the doorway, with her name inscribed below.

ExtraDescription.Description: You see below the relief a single word carved in black runes: TAKHISIS

Room.Name: Outer corridor the the Temple
Room.Description: You stand in the outer corridor of the Temple. Large black stone pillars support the dark stone roof that hovers above you, pulsing with evil. Looking out between the thick pillars, you can see the village of Neraka, and you can see villagers and soldiers alike milling about, glancing at the temple and looking quickly away in fear.

Room.Name: Outer corridor the the Temple
Room.Description: You stand in the outer corridor of the Temple. Large black stone pillars support the dark stone roof that hovers above you, pulsing with evil. Looking out between the thick pillars, you can see the village of Neraka, and you can see villagers and soldiers alike milling about, glancing at the temple and looking quickly away in fear.

Room.Description: You stand in the outer corridor of the Temple. Large black stone pillars support the dark stone roof that hovers above you, pulsing with evil. Room.Name: Outer corridor the the Temple
Room.Description: You stand in the outer corridor of the Temple. Large black stone pillars support the dark stone roof that hovers above you, pulsing with evil. Looking out between the thick pillars, you can see the village of Neraka, and you can see villagers and soldiers alike milling about, glancing at the temple and looking quickly away in fear.

Room.Name: Inside the Southern Entrance
Room.Description: You stand just inside the Southern Entrance to the Temple. Sounds come from everywhere: the sounds of anguished cries, of cheering soldiers, of arguing leaders, of chanting monks. It all blends together too well, too perfectly. The massive stone walls surround you, and torches burn brightly in their sconces. To the south is the light of the outdoors, and to the north ...

Room.Name: Inside the Temple
Room.Description: You stand just inside the Temple to Takhisis. The sounds of clerics praying and monks chanting fills the air more than anything. Acrid incense wafts through the air, assailing your nostrils with burning pain. Your heart is leaping inside your chest and you get the feeling that no matter whether good or evil steps through these doors, lowly peasant to Dragon Highlord, everyone feels the same upon entering this place of darkness.

Room.Name: Main room of the Temple
Room.Description: You stand in the center of the Temple. All around you, you hear voices whispering in your mind, whispering sweet seduction. Monks chant all about you, and clerics utter their prayers to the Dark Queen. The stone walls and floor seem to absorb the light that the black torches are casting from their sconces on the walls. And in the center of this room is a massive black fountain of a headless elf, blood gushing from the neck, carved from the same stone. Dark stairwells lead above and below.

Room.Name: Inside the Temple
Room.Description: You stand just inside the Temple to Takhisis. The sounds of clerics praying and monks chanting fills the air more than anything. Acrid incense wafts through the air, assailing your nostrils with burning pain. Your heart is leaping inside your chest and you get the feeling that no matter whether good or evil steps through these doors, lowly peasant to Dragon Highlord, everyone feels the same upon entering this place of darkness.

Room.Name: Inside the Northern Entrance
Room.Description: You stand just inside the Northern Entrance to the Temple. Sounds come from everywhere: the sounds of anguished cries, of cheering soldiers, of arguing leaders, of chanting monks. It all blends together too well, too perfectly. The massive stone walls surround you, and torches burn brightly in their sconces. To the north is the light of the outdoors, and to the south ...

Room.Name: Inside the Temple
Room.Description: You stand just inside the Temple to Takhisis. The sounds of clerics praying and monks chanting fills the air more than anything. Acrid incense wafts through the air, assailing your nostrils with burning pain. Your heart is leaping inside your chest and you get the feeling that no matter whether good or evil steps through these doors, lowly peasant to Dragon Highlord, everyone feels the same upon entering this place of darkness.

Room.Name: Inside the Temple
Room.Description: You stand inside the Temple. Now all you can hear in the stillness is the beating of your heart. The chants stopped just as soon as you entered this short corridor. The north and south walls are just like all the others, solid black stone, but accentuated with doors. Faint light can be detected coming from underneath them, perhaps the burning of a candle. There are no torches in this part of the hallway; it plunges into shadows at about the same place where you ceased to hear the chanting prayers.

Room.Name: Inside the Temple
Room.Description: You stand just inside the Temple to Takhisis. The sounds of clerics praying and monks chanting fills the air more than anything. Acrid incense wafts through the air, assailing your nostrils with burning pain. Your heart is leaping inside your chest and you get the feeling that no matter whether good or evil steps through these doors, lowly peasant to Dragon Highlord, everyone feels the same upon entering this place of darkness.

Room.Name: Inside the Western Entrance
Room.Description: You stand just inside the Western Entrance to the Temple. Sounds come from everywhere: the sounds of anguished cries, of cheering soldiers, of arguing leaders, of chanting monks. It all blends together too well, too perfectly. The massive stone walls surround you, and torches burn brightly in their sconces. To the west is the light of the outdoors, and to the east ...

Room.Name: A small alcove
Room.Description: You stand inside a small alcove cut into the walls of the Temple, just north of the western entrance. It is a tight fit in here, but it seems like 2 people could squeeze in. A torch burns on the wall above you, casting shadows that flicker eerily about. A pit is here for donations to the Dragonarmy.

Room.Name: A small alcove
Room.Description: You stand inside a small alcove cut into the walls of the Temple, just south of the western entrance. It is a tight fit in here, but it seems like 2 people could squeeze in. A torch burns on the wall above you, casting shadows that flicker eerily about.

Room.Name: A small alcove
Room.Description: You stand inside a small alcove cut into the walls of the Temple, just south of the western entrance. It is a tight fit in here, but it seems like two people could squeeze in. A torch burns on the wall above you, casting shadows that flicker eerily about.

Room.Name: A small alcove
Room.Description: You stand inside a small alcove cut into the walls of the Temple, just south of the western entrance. It is a tight fit in here, but it seems like two people could squeeze in. A torch burns on the wall above you, casting shadows that flicker eerily about.

Room.Name: A black landing
Room.Description: You stand at a landing of the twisted stairwell. The stairs continue upward, still looping around and around in sick circles, but there are also doors here, leading everywhere. This place is deathly silent. Something must be wrong for it to be this quiet here when down below the combination of sounds blended into a chaotic song. Large, silent black oaken doors lead everywhere, and the stairs continue upwards into blackness, and each of them has a plaque above it.

Room.Name: A twisted black stairwell
Room.Description: You stand inside a black stairwell that is lit from some evil source. The very walls pulse with foul powers and are warm to the touch. The stairwell is cramped, and it seems like the walls are closing in on you, almost like something doesn't want you here. The dark stairs lead up to the main hall and down into darkness.

Room.Name: Corridor of Birth
Room.Description: You stand in a long, wide corridor. Torches line it, but you still can't see to the end of the hall. As you look around at the bleak, black walls, nothing comes into your mind as to why this is called the Corridor of Birth. This place looks dead, just like the rest of the Temple. A dark chant begins down the hall, startling you. South is the stairwell, and the corridor continues north.

Room.Name: Corridor of Birth
Room.Description: You stand in a long, wide corridor. Torches line it, but you still can't see to the end of the hall. As you look around at the bleak, black walls, nothing comes into your mind as to why this is called the Corridor of Birth. This place looks dead, just like the rest of the Temple. A dark chant begins down the hall, startling you. The stairwell is further south, and the corridor continues north.

Room.Name: Corridor of Birth
Room.Description: You stand in a long, wide corridor. Torches line it, but you still can't see to the end of the hall. As you look around at the bleak, black walls, nothing comes into your mind as to why this is called the Corridor of Birth. This place looks dead, just like the rest of the Temple. A dark chant begins nearby the hall, startling you. Even though you can barely see a thing here, it sounds like the chanting comes from the end of the hall. As you peer into the shadows, you think you can see humanoid shadows doing unholy things.

Room.Name: Before the Black Altar
Room.Description: You stand before a large altar, surrounded by black-robed mages. One of them places a metallic orb in the center of the altar and the mages touch hands. As they begin to chant, fear creeps up your spine into your head. The chanting continues and the fear grows stronger. Black bolts of energy flow from the touching hands of the mages until they all spark and touch the orb. Slowly, green-black ooze flows from the orb until it uncurls, revealing a small glistening lizard-like figure. It gradually stands and stretches, the chanting dies off, and the lizard is taken to a room to the west. You come to the realization that you have just witnessed the birth of a draconian.

Room.Name: Corridor of Death
Room.Description: To the north lies the stairwell. To the south lies screaming and wails. The hall is black, and from a narrow indenture in the top wall, blood trickles down the length of it, dripping down the walls, off the ceiling, and onto the floor, where your footsteps are sticky. A few other footprints lead down the hall, but a very few lead back to the northern door.

Room.Name: Corridor of Death
Room.Description: To the north lies the stairwell. To the south lies screaming and wails. The hall is black, and from a narrow indenture in the top wall, blood trickles down the length of it, dripping down the walls, off the ceiling, and onto the floor, where your footsteps are sticky. A few other footprints lead down the hall, but a very few lead back to the northern door.

Room.Name: Corridor of Death
Room.Description: To the far north lies the stairwell. To the south lies screaming and wails. The hall is black, and from a narrow indenture in the top wall, blood trickles down the length of it, dripping down the walls, off the ceiling, and onto the floor, where your footsteps are sticky. A few other footprints lead down the hall, but a very few lead back to the northern door. There is more blood here, and the screams are so close they make your ears ring.

Room.Name: Before a black altar
Room.Description: You stand before a black altar, covered in blood and gore. There are no signs of life anywhere but your own ... and that may change soon. Flesh and skin are tossed in the corners of the room, and organs are thrown into a large fire, making the room acrid and smoky. There is not a trace of bone to be found anywhere ... as if the skeletons were stripped of flesh and were taken elsewhere.

Room.Name: Corridor of Magic
Room.Description: You stand inside a lengthy, black hall. However, this hall is much different from the rest of the Temple ... it throbs and hums with intense magical energies, flowing up and down the corridor in waves. You can see right away why this place is called the Corridor of Magic ... and you can feel it in your soul.

Room.Name: Corridor of Magic
Room.Description: You stand inside a lengthy, black hall. However, this hall is much different from the rest of the Temple ... it throbs and hums with intense magical energies, flowing up and down the corridor in waves. You can see right away why this place is called the Corridor of Magic ... and you can feel it in your soul. The feeling grows stronger to the east, and the door to the stairway is back west.

Room.Name: Corridor of Magic
Room.Description: You stand inside a lengthy, black hall. However, this hall is much different from the rest of the Temple ... it throbs and hums with intense magical energies, flowing up and down the corridor in waves. You can see right away why this place is called the Corridor of Magic ... and you can feel it in your soul. By the increase in intensity of the magic, it would seem that the source is very near.

Room.Name: Before a glowing altar
Room.Description: You stand before a circular altar, one that glows and hums with powerful forces. All about you are engraved runes and sigils, sparking with magic. Light spins in a ring in the ceiling, and on the floor it spins the opposite way. Strong magic is here, but it's magic that is unsided and neutral. Additional rooms stretch to the north and south, and the corridor leads back to the west.

Room.Name: Corridor of Might
Room.Description: You stand in the Corridor of Might. Swords, spears and shields line the hall from floor to ceiling. Screams echo from down the hall, screams of battle and pain. Only the strong survive here, it seems. And it is here that they get weeded out for the Army of Takhisis. To the west is the end of the corridor, and to the east is the stairwell.

Room.Name: Corridor of Might
Room.Description: You stand in the Corridor of Might. Swords, spears and shields line the hall from floor to ceiling. Screams echo from down the hall, screams of battle and pain. Only the strong survive here, it seems. And it is here that they get weeded out for the Army of Takhisis. To the west is the end of the corridor, and to the east is the stairwell.

Room.Name: Before a broken altar
Room.Description: You stand before a wooden altar, one that was once mighty and strong, but now is broken. It looks as it it were crushed with a fist rather than with a weapon of any sort. Blood smears the impact site. Splinters have been cleaned up, but the altar still remains broken, a true testament to the kind of warrior that will rise quickly through the ranks of the Dragon Army. To the north and south lie small rooms.

Room.Name: A twisted black staircase
Room.Description: You stand inside a black stairwell that is lit from some evil source. The very walls pulse with foul powers and are warm to the touch. The stairwell is cramped, and it seems like the walls are closing in on you, almost like something doesn't want you here. The dark stairs lead up to a large hall and down into darkness.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Dungeon
Room.Description: You stand at the entrance to the Dungeon. Screams of torment and agony issue from all directions, rebounding endlessly off the black walls. They are like no screams you have heard before. Other sounds come from all around, too ... whips cracking, shouts of guards, and splatterings. All of them are coupled with the screams of the tormented. You can go anywhere from here, but the most comfortable exit is back up to the main floor of the Temple.

Room.Name: A large entryway
Room.Description: You stand inside a massive arched entryway to a large meeting hall. All about you stretches the antechamber, black and smoky. A bad smell wafts from the north, but it's nothing too strong. The entryway opens in all directions, and the stairwell leads back down to the lower levels of the Temple. Torches line the walls and columns of the antechamber, but it's still difficult to see. You can hear the sounds of soldiers and shouting from up north.

Room.Name: Meeting Hall Antechamber
Room.Description: You stand in a large antechamber before a great meeting hall. The walls are high and the ceiling is vaulted, arching up in black waves that pulse with energy and evil. Darkness floats through the room passively, shadowing the light of the torches and thickening the strange haze that floats all about. A great presence can be felt from the north, one that shakes your soul.

Room.Name: Meeting Hall Antechamber
Room.Description: You stand in a large antechamber before a great meeting hall. The walls are high and the ceiling is vaulted, arching up in black waves that pulse with energy and evil. Darkness floats through the room passively, shadowing the light of the torches and thickening the strange haze that floats all about. A great presence can be felt from the north, one that shakes your soul.

Room.Name: Meeting Hall Antechamber
Room.Description: You stand in a large antechamber before a great meeting hall. The walls are high and the ceiling is vaulted, arching up in black waves that pulse with energy and evil. Darkness floats through the room passively, shadowing the light of the torches and thickening the strange haze that floats all about. A great presence can be felt from the north, one that shakes your soul.

Room.Name: Meeting Hall Antechamber
Room.Description: You stand in a large antechamber before a great meeting hall. The walls are high and the ceiling is vaulted, arching up in black waves that pulse with energy and evil. Darkness floats through the room passively, shadowing the light of the torches and thickening the strange haze that floats all about. A great presence can be felt from the north, one that shakes your soul.

Room.Name: Meeting Hall Antechamber
Room.Description: You stand in a large antechamber before a great meeting hall. The walls are high and the ceiling is vaulted, arching up in black waves that pulse with energy and evil. Darkness floats through the room passively, shadowing the light of the torches and thickening the strange haze that floats all about. A great presence can be felt from the north, one that shakes your soul.

Room.Name: Meeting Hall Antechamber
Room.Description: You stand in a large antechamber before a great meeting hall. The walls are high and the ceiling is vaulted, arching up in black waves that pulse with energy and evil. Darkness floats through the room passively, shadowing the light of the torches and thickening the strange haze that floats all about. A great presence can be felt from the north, one that shakes your soul.

Room.Name: Meeting Hall Antechamber
Room.Description: You stand in a large antechamber before a great meeting hall. The walls are high and the ceiling is vaulted, arching up in black waves that pulse with energy and evil. Darkness floats through the room passively, shadowing the light of the torches and thickening the strange haze that floats all about. A great presence can be felt from the north, one that shakes your soul.

Room.Name: A corridor before the Hall
Room.Description: You stand in a large corridor leading from the antechamber to the meeting hall itself. It is a wide corridor indeed, and as you walk you hear and feel your footsteps echoing off the strangely curving walls and ceiling. The worry that you will be caught at this point in the Temple is long gone, replaced by an intense shudder in your body and soul. Perhaps not fear, truly ... more like forced respect.

Room.Name: Storeroom
Room.Description: You stand in a great store room of magical items. Bookshelves line the walls, filled with tomes of power. Other shelves are here as well, filled with magical reagents and other things used for making potions. This room does not seem dark and evil at all; it just seems powerful. The stench of death does not pervade it.

Room.Name: A necromancer's learning room
Room.Description: Here is where the most darkness is in this hall. This small room contains the dark books of black magic and necromancy. A black candle is inside an elven skull on a table here, but it isn't burning. Black flasks sit on the table, unlabelled and unused. This must be where beginners learn, for almost all of the books are not bound in skin and locked with magic and steel.

Room.Name: The Armory
Room.Description: This is the armory where the Army of Takhisis keeps spare weaponry for training new soldiers and draconian hatchlings. The equipment is mostly iron, but some steel and stolen silver weapons line the walls. There is nobody practicing, but a guard keeps watch so that nobody sneaks in and steals the practice weapons. The broken altar is back to the south.

Room.Name: Practice room
Room.Description: This room is filled with sweat and the stench of draconians. Practice dummies sit all about the room, all impaled and slashed in various ways. There is blood, too, spattered on the floor and walls, the result of battles to the death, combat where the strong are chosen from the weak ... and the survivors are the strong. Other than that, the room is fairly nondescript, and looks like the rest of the Temple compound. To the north is the broken altar.

Room.Name: Dragon egg storage room
Room.Description: This room is a treasure trove at first glance, but as you look closer, you realize the sad truth. It is just a stockpile for stolen metallic dragon eggs, the dragon eggs of Paladine. Silver, gold, bronze, copper and brass, all are here, silent and unaware of the fate that awaits them: to become mere footsoldiers in the Army of Takhisis. The only sound here is the sound of the horrible chanting from the black altar to the west.

Room.Name: Draconian hatchling keep
Room.Description: You stand in a room filled with draconians of all sizes, from newborn to full-grown. Every now and again, when the horrific chanting to the east ceases briefly, a black-robed mage will enter and place the newly created draconian down. All of these draconians are less than 6 hours old -- at that age they are trained to become soldiers, and a rare few that the mages select will become more mages, to keep the creation process, along with Takhisis' Army, alive.

Room.Name: Room of Unlife
Room.Description: This is where the animation takes place. A few skeletons are wobbling about, being moved by some unseen force. No necromancers are here, no shadowy figure in black robes. A chill is evident in the room, one that has no feeling to it. Some of the more animated skeletons are picking up iron swords that lie in the corner and advancing on you.

Room.Name: Chamber of Bone
Room.Description: This is true necromancer's work. Here, a few apprentices move back and forth, retrieving bones from one end of the room and taking them to the other, where more experienced necromancers assemble them and bind them together using black magic. The apprentices then take them to the east, and then continue to work. No animation is done here, though.

Room.Name: A corridor before the Hall
Room.Description: You stand in a large corridor leading from the antechamber to the meeting hall itself. It is a wide corridor indeed, and as you walk you hear and feel your footsteps echoing off the strangely curving walls and ceiling. The worry that you will be caught at this point in the Temple is long gone, replaced by an intense shudder in your body and soul. Perhaps not fear, truly ... more like forced respect.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Hall
Room.Description: You are standing under the blackened, arched entrance to the Dragon Highlords' Great Hall. Peering north through the haze in the room, you can see that the hall is large, long, and fairly wide, with six barred cells set into the eastern and western walls. Directly in front of you, there is a feeling of complete and utter hatred, evil, and malice.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. At your north, there is a throne.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. To the west, a green throne can be seen, and from the east, the smell of dragon.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. To the east is the source of the haze and a foul odor.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords

A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. A white throne can barely be seen to the west, and a frosty coldness can be felt from the east.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. To the east seems to be a throne, and to the west, the misty fog billows from an unseen being.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. The haze is somewhat thicker in this part, and it comes from the west.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. The haze is thicker here and seems to be coming from the west.

Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. To the east is the second largest throne in the hall.

It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. To the south, you can see a white throne.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. To the south is a great throne, and upwards lies ... an even bigger throne ... that can only be for one.

Room.Name: In front of Lord Ariakas' Throne
Room.Description: Before you rises the throne of Dragon Highlord Ariakas, commander of the Dragon Army of Takhisis. He has the favor of Takhisis and her respect. Unlike the other Highlords, the throne does not have a group of bodyguards around it, but there is a strong aura of magic all about the throne. With the favor of the Dark Queen, who truly needs bodyguards when magic will not betray you?

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. Immediately to the north lies a grand throne.

Room.Name: Kitiara's Seat
Room.Description: Before you is the seat of the mighty Kitiara, the one called the Dark Lady. She is the Highlord of the Blue, and her seat is surrounded by her soldiers, all dressed in the same midnight blue dragonscale armor as she is. The throne is raised a bit off the floor to show her status. From behind her, thick smoke roils about, and above her, mighty, unseen eyes protect her.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. Directly to the north, however, you see a throne.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze.

Room.Name: In front of the White Highlord's throne
Room.Description: A tall, white throne rises up before you on the stone platform. Its owner, Highlord Lucien, has not yet arrived at the meeting hall, which causes great unrest, considering what happened to Highlord Toede. From this point you can see Lucien's White Guard, and all of the other Highlords' thrones, including the highest throne of all ...

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze.

A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. To your west, a throne can be seen.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze.

Room.Name: Hall of the Dragon Highlords
Room.Description: You stand in the great Meeting Hall of the Dragon Highlords. This is where the commanders of the Dragon Army of Takhisis come to hold audience with their Queen and to conduct official business. A thick, smoky haze is all around, as is a faint but horrible odor. The thrones are arranged about the room, as are contingents of bodyguards. It is difficult to see the other end of the hall through the haze. To the west is a grand throne.

Room.Name: In front of a Highlord's Throne
Room.Description: How odd ... there is no throne here. Just an empty space where there should be one. As such, no bodyguards are here, but soldiers still crowd into this area, just to have a little more room in this hot, humid, stench-filled room. But no matter where they go, they cannot escape the ever-watching eyes of Takhisis, their one Queen.

Room.Name: In front of the Green Highlord's throne
Room.Description: Before you is a green throne, throne of Fewmaster Toede, Dragon Highlord. Except now, reports have come in about his death at the hands of kender. This seat is open to the strongest in the Army who are willing to accept it and the danger that comes with it ... the danger of being assassinated in the middle of the night by a jealous officer's soldiers. The bodyguard still crowds around it, unaware of what has befallen their commander.

Room.Name: A Dragon's cage
Room.Description: You stand inside a dragon's cage. The mist from the dragon's breath is what makes the Hall so foggy. The walls are thick and black, and the bars are wide enough to let something small, like yourself, through. Fear, dragonfear, assaults you as you enter, and the smell of the dragon alone would be enough to make that fear come alive. The only things your legs are willing to do are stand in fear, or flee back west.

Room.Name: A Dragon's cage

Room.Name: The Dungeon
Room.Description: You stand inside the Dungeon. Screams of torment and agony issue from all directions, rebounding endlessly off the black walls. They are like no screams you have heard before. Other sounds come from all around, too ... whips cracking, shouts of guards, and splatterings. All of them are coupled with the screams of the tormented. You can walk about the Dungeon freely for some reason ... there are no cells, and hardly any guards to disturb you. What kind of dungeon is this?

Room.Description: You stand inside the Dungeon. Screams of torment and agony issue from all directions, rebounding endlessly off the black walls. They are like no screams you have heard before. Other sounds come from all around, too ... whips cracking, shouts of guards, and splatterings. All of them are coupled with the screams of the tormented. You can walk about the Dungeon freely for some reason ... there are no cells, and hardly any guards to disturb you. What kind of dungeon is this?

Room.Name: Southeast corner of dungeon
Room.Description: You stand in the southeast corner of the Dungeon. Screams of torment and agony issue from all directions, rebounding endlessly off the black walls. They are like no screams you have heard before. Other sounds come from all around, too ... whips cracking, shouts of guards, and splatterings. All of them are coupled with the screams of the tormented. You can walk about the Dungeon freely for some reason ... there are no cells, and hardly any guards to disturb you. What kind of dungeon is this?

Room.Name: The Dungeon
Room.Description: You stand inside the Dungeon. Screams of torment and agony issue from all directions, rebounding endlessly off the black walls. They are like no screams you have heard before. Other sounds come from all around, too ... whips cracking, shouts of guards, and splatterings. All of them are coupled with the screams of the tormented. You can walk about the Dungeon freely for some reason ... there are no cells, and hardly any guards to disturb you. What kind of dungeon is this?

Room.Name: In the hidden room
Room.Description: This room was sealed off physically and magically for a reason ... in the center of the room is a large white pillar, covered with precious gems of every kind: blue, red, yellow, violet, green .... According to the pattern that is evident, someone has chipped off a large green gemstone. None of the jewels shine in your light, and ancient blood is encrusted on a sharp point of the broken column.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back west.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back west.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back west, and a small breeze blows from the east.

Room.Name: Before the Temple
Room.Description: You stand before the Temple and now you know what it is that you felt upon entering Neraka. It is the presence of an almighty evil, one that will stop at nothing to stop everything. You can see the Temple clearly from here, and you recognize with awe what it is that you see above the doorway.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You stand on an intersection of the streets in Neraka. One leads north and south, the other east and west. East will take you outside the village, and west will lead you directly to the Temple. The wind is dusty and blows very little, though. A stifling heat oppresses the village, though the sky is black and the sun can barely be seen through the clouds.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that parallels the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road intersects the eastern entrance to the Temple, and the road continues on to the north. A bar is close by to the east.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that parallels the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north is a place where the road intersects the eastern entrance to the Temple, and the road continues on to the south. A tavern can be seen to the east, with smoke flowing slowly from the door and the windows.

Room.Name: A smoke-filled bar
Room.Description: This makeshift bar has it all: smoke, ale, women, and drunken soldiers. >From the looks of it, this might be the only tavern open in the village -- but you know better. This is just one of the more convienently located for the soldiers who guard the temple. You might be able to make it to the bar if you're lucky -- and just in time to stop a fight and ask your order, here comes a serving girl.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that parallels the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north is a place where the road intersects the eastern entrance to the Temple, and the road continues on to the south. A soldier's tent is to the east, and a small house lies to the west.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that parallels the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north is a place where the road intersects the eastern entrance to the Temple, and the road continues on to the east.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back west.

Room.Name: Inside a small house
Room.Description: This is one of the many small houses that was disrupted by the coming of the Temple and the Dragonarmy. Now the inhabitants cower in fear that sometime during the night, a group of drunken soldiers will come and slay them in a mad frenzy of bloodlust. The fear is well-deserved, as a bar is just to the north.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on an east west road that leads away from the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west is a bend in the road, and the road continues on to the east, heading under a large arch.

Room.Name: Beneath an arch
Room.Description: You stand beneath a rather tall stone archway, designed to honor troops coming from the east. However, the troops, under the command of Highlord Lucien, never came, along with the Highlord. Treachery is suspected, but not certain. To the north and south are small gates where it looks like you can climb up into the arch itself, and the road stretches on to the east and west.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on an east-west road that leads away from the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the east the road continues away from the Temple, as well as to the west, heading under a large arch.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on an east-west road that leads away from the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the east the road continues away from the Temple, as well as to the west, heading under a large arch. To the north lies a side street.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on an east-west road that leads away from the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. The road stops here abruptly, and the view is one of desolate arid wasteland. Nothing grows here; nothing wants to grow here.

Room.Name: At the base of an arch
Room.Description: The base of the arch is thick and square-shaped, with a thick oak door wide open in front of you. A small ladder leads up into the top of the arch itself, or you can head back under the arch to the south. The shadow cast is refreshing for a moment, and then the hot wind picks up, coating you with dry dust.

Room.Name: At the base of an arch
Room.Description: The base of the arch is thick and square-shaped, with a thick oak door wide open in front of you. A small ladder leads up into the top of the arch itself, or you can head back under the arch to the north. The shadow cast is refreshing for a moment, and then the hot wind picks up, coating you with dry dust.

Room.Name: At the top of the arch
Room.Description: You have climbed up the tower to the top of the arch. You can continue southwards to the center, or climb back down the small ladder to the base of the arch. There's not much to see here, but light comes from openings in the arch to the south. Something about this arch seems a bit misplaced, too.

Room.Name: At the top of the arch
Room.Description: You have climbed up the tower to the top of the arch. You can continue northwards to the center, or climb back down the small ladder to the base of the arch. There's not much to see here, but light comes from openings in the arch to the north. Something about this arch seems a bit misplaced, too.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that parallels the Temple, which is immediately to the west, so close that you can touch it. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road intersects the eastern entrance to the Temple, and the road continues on to the north.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that parallels the Temple, which is immediately to the west, so close that you can touch it. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road intersects the eastern entrance to the Temple, and the road continues on to the north. To the west, squeezed in between the Temple and the road, is a small tent.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You stand at a turn of one of the streets in Neraka, and there are small buildings around you. From here the image and feel of the Temple still loom deeply in your mind, and they probably always will. You are surrounded by noises, with loud banging to the north and a quieter sort of chopping to the east. The winding street continues to the west and south.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on an east-west road that parallels the Temple, which is close to the south. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a small soldier's tent, and the road moves on to the west.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You stand at a curve in the village street, that leads north and east. The Temple looms up to the south. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north, you can see that the road continues to wind, and the streets move a short distance to the east before they start to bend.

Room.Name: Behind a tent
Room.Description: You stand behind a tent of a Dragon Army soldier. The flap is blowing a little in the hot wind, but the wind offers no relief in the hot sun. It just coats you with dry dust that sticks to your skin and dries out your mouth. You can duck under the flap to enter the tent to the west, or you can go back to the village streets to the east and south.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a short road that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the east is a junction with the main road, and to the north you can see the back flap of a tent hanging open.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road begins to wind, and the road continues on to the north.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road begins to wind, and the road continues on to the north. The back flap of a tent is open to the west.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road begins to wind, and the road continues on to the north. To the west you see a tent.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You stand at a curve in the village street, that leads north and east. The Temple looms up to the south. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north, you can see that the road continues to wind, and the streets move a short distance to the east before they start to bend.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You stand at a curve in the village street, that leads south and west. The Temple looms up to the south. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west, you can see that the road continues to wind, and the streets move a short distance to the south before they start to bend.

Room.Name: Before the Temple
Room.Description: You stand before the Temple and now you know what it is that you felt upon entering Neraka. It is the presence of an almighty evil, one that will stop at nothing to stop everything. You can see the Temple clearly from here, and you recognize with awe what it is that you see above the doorway.

Room.Name: Village road
Room.Description: You walk still on a wide, cobblestone road through Neraka. To the east, like a hideous nightmare, looms the Temple. To the west, the road continues on to the guard gates. All about you, there are draconians, mercenaries, and a few citizens. They mill about in the heat and fear that the Temple generates. There is a feeling in the air of despair, hatred and terror, and they all emanate from the black Temple. The sky above is continually black, even during the day.

Room.Name: Village road
Room.Description: You walk still on a wide, cobblestone road through Neraka. To the east, like a hideous nightmare, looms the Temple. To the west, the road continues on to the guard gates. All about you, there are draconians, mercenaries, and a few citizens. They mill about in the heat and fear that the Temple generates. There is a feeling in the air of despair, hatred and terror, and they all emanate from the black Temple. The sky above is continually black, even during the day.

Room.Name: Burning trash dump
Room.Description: Before you rises a large trash pile, burning wildly, sending a bad stench rising into the wind. The smell isn't really one of trash, though, it's more of a smell of decay and death. Then it hits you like the foul odor did: this isn't a trash dump, it's a crematorium for sacrifices to the Dark Queen.

Room.Name: The western city gates
Room.Description: So these are the western city gates of Neraka ... one look at the masonry tells you that they were constructed hastily but with great attention to their strength. A massive blackened metal gate spans the gap between the grey stone walls, but it is swung wide open. To the north and south, you can see guard towers. West will take you into the encampment, and east lies the village, and the temple itself.

Room.Name: Western outskirts
Room.Description: You walk on a hard dirt road that leads westwards from Neraka. It is dusty and hot here, and the presence of the Temple invades and assaults your mind and soul with terrible respect and fear. To the west and all around you are hundreds of tents, and the western gates are back to the east. Many of the tracks in the dust lead straight west, where you can hear shouting, and steam rises up from a tent.

Room.Name: At the base of a watchtower
Room.Description: You stand at the base of a fairly tall guard tower. It is made from grey stone, and its craftmanship shows signs of a quick build. It was probably built by the Dragonarmy when they moved in to occupy Neraka. You can head up into the guard tower itself, or back south to the city gates.

Room.Name: At the top of a watchtower
Room.Description: You are at the top of the stone watchtower that overlooks the city gates. From a large window you can see all the way west to the city limits. In this small room are some extra bowstrings and an extra quiver of arrows for the archers, who, upon sign of any enemy army's intrusion into the village, will rain arrows down upon them until the ground troops can meet them in combat. A small ladder leads down to the base.

Room.Name: At the bottom of a watchtower
Room.Description: You stand at the base of a fairly tall guard tower. It is made from grey stone, and its craftmanship shows signs of a quick build. It was probably built by the Dragonarmy when they moved in to occupy Neraka. You can head up into the guard tower itself, or back north to the city gates.

Room.Name: At the top of a watchtower
Room.Description: You are at the top of the stone watchtower that overlooks the city gates. From a large window you can see all the way west to the city limits. In this small room are some extra bowstrings and an extra quiver of arrows for the archers, who, upon sign of any enemy army's intrusion into the village, will rain arrows down upon them until the ground troops can meet them in combat. A small ladder leads down to the base.

Room.Name: Western outskirts
Room.Description: You walk on a hard dirt road that leads westwards from Neraka. It is dusty and hot here, and the presence of the Temple invades and assaults your mind and soul with terrible respect and fear. To the west and all around you are hundreds of tents, and the western gates are back to the east. Many of the tracks in the dust lead straight west, where you can hear shouting, and steam rises up from a tent.

Room.Name: Western outskirts
Room.Description: You walk on a hard dirt road that leads westwards from Neraka. It is dusty and hot here, and the presence of the Temple invades and assaults your mind and soul with terrible respect and fear. To the west and all around you are hundreds of tents, and the western gates are back to the east. Many of the tracks in the dust lead straight west, where you can hear shouting, and steam rises up from a tent.

Room.Name: Western outskirts
Room.Description: You walk on a hard dirt road that leads westwards from Neraka. It is dusty and hot here, and the presence of the Temple invades and assaults your mind and soul with terrible respect and fear. To the west and all around you are hundreds of tents, and the western gates are back to the south and east.

Room.Name: Western outskirts
Room.Description: You walk on a hard dirt road that leads westwards from Neraka. It is dusty and hot here, and the presence of the Temple invades and assaults your mind and soul with terrible respect and fear. To the west and all around you are hundreds of tents, and the western gates are back to the north and east.

Room.Name: Western outskirts
Room.Description: You walk on a hard dirt road that leads westwards from Neraka. It is dusty and hot here, and the presence of the Temple invades and assaults your mind and soul with terrible respect and fear. To the west and all around you are hundreds of tents, and the western gates are back to the east. You can hear shouting from the west, and bad odor drifts along on the nigh-still wind.

Room.Name: Western outskirts
Room.Description: You walk on a hard dirt road that leads westwards from Neraka. It is dusty and hot here, and the presence of the Temple invades and assaults your mind and soul with terrible respect and fear. To the west and all around you are hundreds of tents, and the western gates are back to the east. To the north you see a tent, from which a foul smell and a lot of shouting come. To the south is a soldier's tent.

Room.Name: Before the mess tent
Room.Description: To your west lies a large grey tent, from which shouts and drunken jeers resound. A horrible stench wafts from that way in the hot, humid air. All about you are draconians, mercenaries, and a few citizens, wandering about in the heat and fear generated by the Temple, which lies further to the east. A small road also leads south from here.

Room.Name: The mess tent
Room.Description: You are inside the massive grey mess tent, and it is indeed a mess. Food is strewn about chaotically, and many soldiers are eating hungrily at long wooden tables. You could probably sit down unnoticed and eat a meal as well, if you could stomach the food, whatever it is. It looks like a thin stew made of organ meats and other nasty things. It's even hotter in here than it is outside. The mess tent stretches out for quite some way to the west, and the entrance is back to the east.

Room.Name: Road to Neraka
Room.Description: You are walking along a dusty, well-travelled road heading south and west. The hard-packed soil makes you think about how much traffic this place must be getting, and then you wonder about who is making all this dust and footprints. Ahead, to the south, you see something dark and massive looming on the horizon. There is a sign here, announcing that you are on the road to the village of Neraka.

ExtraDescription.Description: At one time, this thick wooden sign simply said "Road to Neraka." Now, it says this: "Road to Neraka. All of the light are hereby warned of the mortal peril that you will face to the south. Proceed no further if you value your life and your soul." Below, there is the mark of a five-headed dragon.

Room.Name: A dusty trail
Room.Description: You are walking along a dusty, well-travelled road heading south and west. The hard-packed soil makes you think about how much traffic this place must be getting, and then you wonder about who is making all this dust and footprints. Ahead, to the south, you see something dark and massive looming on the horizon.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road begins to wind, and the road continues on to the north. You can also head east to another street.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road begins to wind, and the road stops suddenly here.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on an east-west road that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the east the street heads on for a little way, and a small intersection to the west.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on an east-west road that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north the street heads on for a little way, and a small ruined building is to the west.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road begins to wind, and the road continues on to the north.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You stand on an intersection of the streets of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road begins to wind, and a small tent is to the north. Eastwards yields a short street.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You stand on a dirt street that leads through the village of Neraka. You can see the Temple from here, dark as night. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. You are between a tent and a ruined building, and the street lies wearily to the west.

Room.Name: Ruined smithy
Room.Description: You stand inside a crumbled and ruined smithy. Massive stones litter the floor, and gigantic molten puddles of metal coat the floor. A few particular blobs look like statues that the blacksmith made before the destruction of Neraka was brought down by the Dark Queen ... until you realize that real people were caught inside that metal and formed those statues.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back south.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back west.

Room.Name: The Neraka Armory
Room.Description: This is the Neraka Armory. Before the Dragonarmy came, most of this man's income came from supplying passing travellers with light armor. Now it comes from the Highlords, who don't pay him nearly enough for making the difficult to make Dragonarmor, which he will only sell to a Highlord. Otherwise, he's making some light chain mail and the like for the passers-by that are lucky enough to survive the trip here.

Room.Name: The meat market
Room.Description: You stand in a sparsely decorated room, one that smells of blood and raw meat. The butcher looks up at you for a moment, then goes back to his work. The offerings are slim here, as most of the fresher, higher quality meat has been bought or simply stolen by the Dragonarmy. The high prices are a result of this. A sign, smeared with blood, is posted on a wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The sign reads: Due to increased demand for better meats prices have to be raised slightly. I apologize for this and I hope to lower them soon. Thank you for your continued business.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north and south, the road continues on.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north and south, the road continues on.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north and south, the road continues on. And to the east, you can enter the outer corridor of the Temple.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. The road curves north and east.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west and east, the road continues on.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west and east, the road continues on.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west and east, the road continues on. Close to the east, you spot an entrance to the Temple.

Room.Name: Before the Temple
Room.Description: You stand before the Temple and now you know what it is that you felt upon entering Neraka. It is the presence of an almighty evil, one that will stop at nothing to stop everything. You can see the Temple clearly from here, and you recognize with awe what it is that you see above the doorway.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west and east, the road continues on. Close to the north, you can enter the Temple's outer corridor.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west and east, the road continues on.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west and east, the road continues on.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west and east, the road continues on.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the west and east, the road continues on. And to the west, you see an entrance to the Temple.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the north and south the road continues, and an entrance to the Temple is close by to the north.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. The road continues north. The city gates are to the south, and a side street leads east.

Room.Name: Southern city gates
Room.Description: So these are the southern city gates of Neraka ... one look at the masonry tells you that they were constructed hastily but with great attention to their strength. A massive blackened metal gate spans the gap between the grey stone walls, but it is swung wide open. To the east and west, you can see guard towers. Going south will take you into the encampment, and north lies the village and Temple of Takhisis itself.

Room.Name: Southern Road to Neraka
Room.Description: You are walking on the southern road to Neraka. It is well-travelled and hardened from thousands of feet walking on it at once. Dust rises with each step that you take, resulting in a visible trail behind you. To the north, the Temple of Takhisis rises high up like an eternal shadow over the land, pulsating with intense immortal dread. To the south, the road continues on monotonously. Directly north, you see the city gates.

Exit.Description: The Southern Gates of Neraka rise up.

Room.Name: Southern Road to Neraka
Room.Description: You are walking on the southern road to Neraka. It is well-travelled and hardened from thousands of feet walking on it at once. Dust rises with each step that you take, resulting in a visible trail behind you. To the north, the Temple of Takhisis rises high up like an eternal shadow over the land, pulsating with intense immortal dread. To the south, the road continues on monotonously.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. The road moves to the east for a short distance. To the south is a village house.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a road that leads through the damned village of Neraka. You can see the black mass of the Temple from here. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. The road heads back west, while you are surrounded by ruined and whole building on all other sides.

Room.Name: An empty building
Room.Description: The only thing that you can see upon entering this building is a cobweb coated in yellow dust, abandoned long ago. The stone walls are bare, completely devoid of any markings or windows. Wind howls through the door, blasting you with dust. You get the feeling that you are the only one who has seen the inside of this building for a long time.

Room.Name: A pile of rubble
Room.Description: No traces of what this pile used to be remain to tell its tale. No smashed furniture, no broken glass, not even any blood. Just a shattered stone building of some sort, broken until only a few broken wooden support beams stick up out of the ruin. The street lies back to the north.

Room.Name: A villager's house
Room.Description: You stand inside one of the few houses left standing after the destruction of Neraka that hasn't been abandoned in anger and fear. It looks lived-in and poor, and the evil of the Temple permeates this house like the very air. Very little decorates this house except a table and a few chairs.

Room.Name: A villager's house
Room.Description: You stand inside one of the few houses left standing after the destruction of Neraka that hasn't been abandoned in anger and fear. It looks lived-in and poor, and the evil of the Temple permeates this house like the very air. Very little decorates this house except a table and a few chairs.

Room.Name: Southern path outside the village
Room.Description: You walk on a narrow dirt path outside the village, riddled with holes and stones. It is travelled significantly less than the rest of the roads of Neraka, but they are still worn and hard. Not much activity goes on here, as the south seems more exposed to the elements than any other part of the area. The sun is hotter, the wind is stronger and the dust is drier, but nothing can take your mind away from the Temple, leering at you like a mirage.

Room.Name: Southern path outside the village
Room.Description: You walk on a narrow dirt path outside the village, riddled with holes and stones. It is travelled significantly less than the rest of the roads of Neraka, but they are still worn and hard.
