The sun is hotter, the wind is stronger and the dust is drier, but nothing can take your mind away from the Temple, leering at you like a mirage.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back south.

Room.Name: A pile of rubble
Room.Description: No traces of what this pile used to be remain to tell its tale. No smashed furniture, no broken glass, not even any blood. Just a shattered stone building of some sort, broken until only a few broken wooden support beams stick up out of the ruin. The street lies back to the north.

Room.Name: Inside the base of a guard tower
Room.Description: You stand at the base of a fairly tall guard tower. It is made from grey stone, and its craftmanship shows signs of a quick build. It was probably built by the Dragonarmy when they moved in to occupy Neraka. You can head up into the guard tower itself, or back west to the city gates.

Room.Name: At the top of the tower
Room.Description: You are at the top of the stone watchtower that overlooks the city gates. From a large window you can see all the way south to the city limits. In this small room are some extra bowstrings and an extra quiver of arrows for the archers, who, upon sign of any enemy army's intrusion into the village, will rain arrows down upon them until the ground troops can meet them in combat. A small ladder leads down to the base.

Room.Name: Inside the bottom of a guard tower
Room.Description: You stand at the base of a fairly tall guard tower. It is made from grey stone, and its craftmanship shows signs of a quick build. It was probably built by the Dragonarmy when they moved in to occupy Neraka. You can head up into the guard tower itself, or back east to the city gates.

Room.Name: A destroyed building
Room.Description: You stand amidst a small stone ruin of a building that must have once been some sort of apothecary's shop. Broken glass litters the ground, and the stones are colored, as if from dyes. A bad smell pervades the place, but it's the smell of burnt chemicals and reagents, not of flesh. Surprising, considering who did this. What's left of the door leads back to the south.

Room.Name: Inside the eastern city gates
Room.Description: So these are the eastern city gates of Neraka ... one look at the masonry tells you that they were constructed hastily but with great attention to their strength. A massive blackened metal gate spans the gap between the grey stone walls, but it is swung wide open. To the north and south, you can see guard towers. East will take you into the encampment, and west lies the village itself.

Room.Name: Eastern path outside the village
Room.Description: You walk on a small dirt path outside of the village of Neraka. Dirt and loose stones litter the outside edge of the track. Dust blows up and swirls in the hot dry air, and small pebbles beat against the stone buildings and canvas tents. To the west lies the Temple, a beacon of despair and hatred in the world. To the east are a few buildings and hundreds of tents.

Room.Name: Eastern path outside the village
Room.Description: You walk on a small dirt path outside of the village of Neraka. Dirt and loose stones litter the outside edge of the track. Dust blows up and swirls in the hot dry air, and small pebbles beat against the stone buildings and canvas tents. To the west lies the Temple, a beacon of despair and hatred in the world. To the east are a few buildings and hundreds of tents.

Room.Name: Eastern path outside the village

To the east are a few buildings and hundreds of tents.

Room.Name: Eastern path outside the village
Room.Description: You walk on a small dirt path outside of the village of Neraka. Dirt and loose stones litter the outside edge of the track. Dust blows up and swirls in the hot dry air, and small pebbles beat against the stone buildings and canvas tents. To the west lies the Temple, a beacon of despair and hatred in the world. To the east are a few buildings and hundreds of tents.

Room.Name: A dirty pub
Room.Description: This place caters to all of the common soldiers and mercenaries in the army, simply because it is cheap and the ale is strong. A bartender stands behind the bar, running to and fro to replenish kegs and mugs for those seated at and standing around the bar. A few worn-out serving girls weave their way through the crowd to bring more beer and ale to the soldiers. Nobody pauses to look at you.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back south.

Room.Name: A smelly trash dump
Room.Description: This massive pile of garbage and waste is the product of so many thousands of soldiers in one place at one time. It probably started out as the product of the pub across the street, but it has escalated rapidly into a full-fledged waste heap. There's no telling what kind of diseases are floating around in the air here.

Room.Name: Eastern path outside the village
Room.Description: You walk on a small dirt path outside of the village of Neraka. Dirt and loose stones litter the outside edge of the track. Dust blows up and swirls in the hot dry air, and small pebbles beat against the stone buildings and canvas tents. To the west lies the Temple, a beacon of despair and hatred in the world. To the east are a few buildings and hundreds of tents.

Room.Name: An empty, ruined building
Room.Description: You stand inside a hollow shell of a building. The back half has been shattered, and harsh sunlight pours in. A desk is in the back, along with a sign. A few signs are posted up on the walls still, the kind of signs that a bank would have. If this was the bank, then it was looted long ago. The gold and silver within probably went to fund the army. Back to the east is the door to the street.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back north.

Room.Name: At the base of a guard tower
Room.Description: You stand at the base of a fairly tall guard tower. It is made from grey stone, and its craftmanship shows signs of a quick build. It was probably built by the Dragonarmy when they moved in to occupy Neraka. You can head up into the guard tower itself, or back west to the city gates.

Room.Description: You are at the top of the stone watchtower that overlooks the city gates. From a large window you can see all the way east to the city limits. In this small room are some extra bowstrings and an extra quiver of arrows for the archers, who, upon sign of any enemy army's intrusion into the village, will rain arrows down upon them until the ground troops can meet them in combat. A small ladder leads down to the base.

Room.Description: You are at the top of the stone watchtower that overlooks the city gates. From a large window you can see all the way east to the city limits. In this small room are some extra bowstrings and an extra quiver of arrows for the archers, who, upon sign of any enemy army's intrusion into the village, will rain arrows down upon them until the ground troops can meet them in combat. A small ladder leads down to the base.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that parallels the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road intersects the eastern entrance to the Temple, and the road continues on to the north. A bar lies to the east, and shouts can be heard from here.

Room.Name: Streets of Neraka
Room.Description: You walk on a north-south road that parallels the Temple, which is to the west. Try as you might, the image of the foul black construction is etched in your mind and you cannot and will never forget it. To the south is a place where the road intersects the eastern entrance to the Temple. The road dead-ends here, trailing off until there is nothing left of it.

Room.Name: A filthy tavern
Room.Description: This must be one of the dirtier taverns in Neraka, judging by the dirty people here. Draconians are passed out at the bar and on tables, and minotaurs are still drinking heavily. The bartender is easy to get to, once you start shoving and pushing your way in. He looks up at you with anger in his eyes. This must not be the most fun to be had in Neraka, working here.

Room.Name: In the back room
Room.Description: This is the back room of the tavern, where other ... business is conducted. It's a lot quieter here. Well, it's a different kind of noise here. You're surprised you haven't seen more of these establishments around Neraka, since there are so many soldiers here with no war to fight. There is a note tacked to the wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The note reads: Sorry about this but we got to go. It's too hard here working so we are leaving to go to somewhere else. Goodbye. You soldiers are too hard to us.

Room.Name: The Underhalls
Room.Description: You stand in the Underhalls ... a place that few mortals have ever seen and lived to speak of. That is because this is where the torments of the Temple emanate, where the very souls of the tortured are burned in fire from the Abyss. Your light is the only one here. Not even the black fires which burn all about give off light, only eternal heat.

Room.Name: The Underhalls
Room.Description: You stand in the Underhalls ... a place that few mortals have ever seen and lived to speak of. That is because this is where the torments of the Temple emanate, where the very souls of the tortured are burned in fire from the Abyss. Your light is the only one here. Not even the black fires which burn all about give off light, only eternal heat.

Room.Name: The Underhalls
Room.Description: You stand in the Underhalls ... a place that few mortals have ever seen and lived to speak of. That is because this is where the torments of the Temple emanate, where the very souls of the tortured are burned in fire from the Abyss. Your light is the only one here. Not even the black fires which burn all about give off light, only eternal heat. To the east and west are two small cells.

Room.Name: The Underhalls
Room.Description: You stand in the Underhalls ... a place that few mortals have ever seen and lived to speak of. That is because this is where the torments of the Temple emanate, where the very souls of the tortured are burned in fire from the Abyss. Your light is the only one here. Not even the black fires which burn all about give off light, only eternal heat.

Room.Name: The Underhalls
Room.Description: You stand in the Underhalls ... a place that few mortals have ever seen and lived to speak of. That is because this is where the torments of the Temple emanate, where the very souls of the tortured are burned in fire from the Abyss. Your light is the only one here. Not even the black fires which burn all about give off light, only eternal heat. To the north and south are two small cells.

Room.Name: The Underhalls
Room.Description: You stand in the Underhalls ... a place that few mortals have ever seen and lived to speak of. That is because this is where the torments of the Temple emanate, where the very souls of the tortured are burned in fire from the Abyss. Your light is the only one here. Not even the black fires which burn all about give off light, only eternal heat.

Room.Name: The Underhalls
Room.Description: You stand in the Underhalls ... a place that few mortals have ever seen and lived to speak of. That is because this is where the torments of the Temple emanate, where the very souls of the tortured are burned in fire from the Abyss. Your light is the only one here. Not even the black fires which burn all about give off light, only eternal heat. To the east and west are two small cells.

Room.Name: The Underhalls
Room.Description: You stand in the Underhalls ... a place that few mortals have ever seen and lived to speak of. That is because this is where the torments of the Temple emanate, where the very souls of the tortured are burned in fire from the Abyss. Your light is the only one here. Not even the black fires which burn all about give off light, only eternal heat.

Room.Name: The Underhalls
Room.Description: You stand in the Underhalls ... a place that few mortals have ever seen and lived to speak of. That is because this is where the torments of the Temple emanate, where the very souls of the tortured are burned in fire from the Abyss. Your light is the only one here. Not even the black fires which burn all about give off light, only eternal heat. To the north and south are two small cells.

Room.Name: A cell
Room.Description: Inside this blackened, burned cell, you see utter horror. A prisoner is stuck in the wall, not in a hole, but in the wall itself. His screams echo down the stony corridor as his entrails are constantly torn out and replaced by unseen hands. Blood pours from his mouth towards the floor, but is caught by some invisible maw, drinking hungrily.

Room.Name: A cell
Room.Description: A fire rages in this room. It engulfs a prisoner and seemingly chews on him, savoring the agony and pain in its meal. Then the prisoner is spit out against the wall, still on fire. Then, magically, the flames on the prisoner are extinguished, his wounds are healed, and the fire begins to chew on his prisoner once more.

Room.Name: A cell
Room.Description: A room of pure thickness ... you find it very hard to breathe in here. An almost liquid feeling invades your lungs every time you inhale, and then you realize that it really is liquid, and you are starting to itch all over. It gets harder and harder to breathe in here, but the prisoners continue to do so, even though they are nailed to the wall. You start to feel your lungs burning, too, and you have a fierce desire to escape west.

Room.Name: A cell
Room.Description: A puddle is in the middle of the floor, leaking blood. A skeleton is crawling slowly away from it. Your first thought is that the man's flesh was stripped away with a necromancer's spell, but then you realize that the puddle is still alive, is still a breathing, living creature. The skeleton, now on its feet and moved by a will stronger than its own, forces itself back inside the puddle, and the man is whole. Whole, that is, until a cleaver splits his back open, and the skeleton tears its way free again.

Room.Name: A cell
Room.Description: You stand inside the cell of a tortured elf, screaming for mercy. His eyes have been stitched shut with thick, black string and he has been crucified upside down on the wall. There is no indication of any harm being done to him at all, but two small demons circle his head, screaming horribly. A third is constantly tearing apart the flesh of small living creatures, and throwing the entrails and blood on the elf's face. One of the other demons then licks all of it off.

Room.Name: A cell
Room.Description: There is only one thing to see in this cell, and it is horrible. A prisoner is suspended in mid-air by steel chains, while a fire burns underneath him, scorching him and filling the air with the smell of burnt flesh and hair. Two small demons cut off small pieces of his body and shove them inside the prisoner's mouth. His eyes are held open with magic, and his screams never leave his mouth.

Room.Name: A cell
Room.Description: Inside this blackened, burned cell, you see utter horror. A prisoner is stuck in the wall, not in a hole, but in the wall itself. His screams echo down the stony corridor as his entrails are constantly torn out and replaced by unseen hands. Blood pours from his mouth towards the floor, but is caught by some invisible maw, drinking hungrily, and always satiated.

Room.Name: A cell
Room.Description: You stand inside a charred dungeon cell, blackened and burned. It reeks of seared flesh and tangible pain. Your light falls upon metal shackles bolted securely into the wall, and as you look at many lumps in them, you realize in horror that the lumps are chunks of incinerated flesh burnt permanently to the shackles. Cries of anguish echo from everywhere in this cell.

Room.Name: In the Darkness
Room.Description: You stand in the midst of an impenetrable darkness. It claims you and grasps you in an unholy way. The scent of the abysmal air and the rhythm with which it moves tells you that there is something down here, something huge and evil that is watching you, even in this darkness. You have an urge to leave this place now ...

Room.Name: A run-down supply store
Room.Description: This store once was a haven for travellers who came this way, but now its just for travellers who are unfortunate enough to come this far. The store is dilapidated and running down, as is the old man sitting behind the counter. He barely looks up as you walk in. Something here could be of some use ... possibly.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back west.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back west.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back north.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back east.

Room.Name: At the base of a guard tower
Room.Description: You stand at the base of a fairly tall guard tower. It is made from grey stone, and its craftmanship shows signs of a quick build. It was probably built by the Dragonarmy when they moved in to occupy Neraka. You can head up into the guard tower itself, or back west to the city gates.

Room.Name: At the top of a guard tower
Room.Description: You are at the top of the stone watchtower that overlooks the city gates. From a large window you can see all the way north to the city limits. In this small room are some extra bowstrings and an extra quiver of arrows for the archers, who, upon sign of any enemy army's intrusion into the village, will rain arrows down upon them until the ground troops can meet them in combat. A small ladder leads down to the base.

Room.Name: At the base of a guard tower
Room.Description: You stand at the base of a fairly tall guard tower. It is made from grey stone, and its craftmanship shows signs of a quick build. It was probably built by the Dragonarmy when they moved in to occupy Neraka. You can head up into the guard tower itself, or back east to the city gates.

Room.Name: At the top of a guard tower
Room.Description: You are at the top of the stone watchtower that overlooks the city gates. From a large window you can see all the way north to the city limits. In this small room are some extra bowstrings and an extra quiver of arrows for the archers, who, upon sign of any enemy army's intrusion into the village, will rain arrows down upon them until the ground troops can meet them in combat. A small ladder leads down to the base.

Room.Name: Inside a tent
Room.Description: You are inside a Dragonarmy tent, hastily erected amidst the others. This is just one of the easily accessible, but there are others ... there are hundreds upon hundreds of others. The inside of the tent is fairly nondescript; it's a white canvas tent, with a small cot in the corner and a small footlocker for keeping spare rations and personal belongings in. The entrance to the tent is back south.

Room.Name: House of Ill Repute
Room.Description: Well, there's an army full of men, so a house like this in an encampment is almost mandatory. A few girls wander about, a bit shaken, but conscious of the waiting ... "customers." One looks at you, shakes her head, and turns away to approach a human mercenary. After waiting for a bit, you begin to think that nobody wants to pay attention to you.

Room.Name: A dusty trail
Room.Description: You are walking along a dusty, well-travelled road heading east and west. The hard-packed soil makes you think about how much traffic this place must be getting, and then you wonder about who is making all this dust and footprints. Ahead, to the south, you see something dark and massive looming on the horizon.

Room.Name: Southern Road to Neraka
Room.Description: You are walking on the southern road to Neraka. It is well-travelled and hardened from thousands of feet walking on it at once. Dust rises with each step that you take, resulting in a visible trail behind you. To the north, the Temple of Takhisis rises high up like an eternal shadow over the land, pulsating with intense immortal dread. To the south, the road continues on monotonously.

Room.Name: Southern Road to Neraka
Room.Description: You are walking on the southern road to Neraka. It is well-travelled and hardened from thousands of feet walking on it at once. Dust rises with each step that you take, resulting in a visible trail behind you. To the north, the Temple of Takhisis rises high up like an eternal shadow over the land, pulsating with intense immortal dread. To the south, the road continues on monotonously.

Room.Name: Southern Road to Neraka
Room.Description: You are walking on the southern road to Neraka. It is well-travelled and hardened from thousands of feet walking on it at once. Dust rises with each step that you take, resulting in a visible trail behind you. To the north, the Temple of Takhisis rises high up like an eternal shadow over the land, pulsating with intense immortal dread. To the south, the road continues on monotonously.

Room.Name: Southern path outside the village
Room.Description: You walk on a narrow dirt path outside the village, riddled with holes and stones. It is travelled significantly less than the rest of the roads of Neraka, but they are still worn and hard. Not much activity goes on here, as the south seems more exposed to the elements than any other part of the area. The sun is hotter, the wind is stronger and the dust is drier, but nothing can take your mind away from the Temple, leering at you like a mirage.

Room.Name: Southern path outside the village
Room.Description: You walk on a narrow dirt path outside the village, riddled with holes and stones. It is travelled significantly less than the rest of the roads of Neraka, but they are still worn and hard. Not much activity goes on here, as the south seems more exposed to the elements than any other part of the area. The sun is hotter, the wind is stronger and the dust is drier, but nothing can take your mind away from the Temple, leering at you like a mirage.

Room.Name: Southern path outside the village
Room.Description: You walk on a narrow dirt path outside the village, riddled with holes and stones. It is travelled significantly less than the rest of the roads of Neraka, but they are still worn and hard. Not much activity goes on here, as the south seems more exposed to the elements than any other part of the area. The sun is hotter, the wind is stronger and the dust is drier, but nothing can take your mind away from the Temple, leering at you like a mirage.
